1.title: Choice A Girl

112.content:
Raven was doing her night patrol over part of the city as she was flying over some of the warehouse's she had heard a alarm go off. She decided to check it out before calling it in to the others incase it was just some simple thugs she could easily take care off. She landed in front of the warehouse the alarm was coming from the lock on it was broken and the door was ajarred open.

She looked around the area to see if she could see anyone before going in incase it was a trap but not seeing anything she decided to go in. She made some of her black energy cover her hands ready to blast anyone or anything that might jump out at her. She slipped in doing her best not to move the door to much so not to let anyone know someone else might have entered the building.

She looked around quitely in the warehouse for anyone that wasn't suppose to be here it was a bit hard as the warehouse was big, dark, quite a lot of boxes. As she moved between boxes been quite as she can she hadn't seen anyone else in the warehouse. She soon came to the middle of the warehouse which to see to her surprise was cleaned of any boxes leaving a fifteen foot square space free of anything but one thing a chair. Which was in the center of the cleared space it was bolted to the ground with brown leather and looked comfortable. But she could see bondages on the arms and legs of the chair.

"I wonder what that is for" Raven said, dropping her guard for a moment which was a moment to long

"For you" A voice said behind her

Raven turned around to attack the person but it was to late as she felt a sharp pain in the back of her head and then saw complete darkness.

(Some time later)

Raven was slowly coming to in a gruggy state her head was still hurting from the hit she tried to raise a hand to rub the sore spot but her hand was stopped. She looked down at her hands thankfully where she was, was still dark so her eyes really didn't need to adjust to anything. She saw that her hand was bonded by some leather strap she pulled it a few times hoping to break them but it held strong. That is when she notice her other hand and even feet where bonded the same she gave them all a pull but again they held strong.

It had taken her a few seconds but she soon realize she was still in the warehouse and not only that but strap to the chair in the middle of the warehouse.

"What the hell is going on?" Raven said, still trying to break the bonds but her physical strength was good enough to break them

"Duh my magic" She said, feeling stupid having forgotten about that

"Azarath Metrion Zinthos" Raven chanted out

But instead of her bonds releasing her or breaking off or something nothing had happen. Which had surprise and worried Raven a bit she chanted her words again a few times but again nothing happen. She even tried to make her black energy form around her hands but it wasn't happen.

"What the hell is happening? Why won't my powers work?" Raven asked no one perticaullar

"That would be because of the amulets" A voice answered her

Raven looked up to see who spoke but suddenly a bright light shined down on her from above causing her to shut her eyes. She whinced a little trying to see who was talking but her eyes haven't adjusted yet so she could only see a shadowy blur.

"You see I placed three special amulets in the chair they have the effect to cancle any magical abilities in other words your magic is been cancled and you can't use it." The voice said, Raven can hear the person grinning

"What do you want with me? Who are you? Why you doing this?" Raven asked still struggling against the bonds which made the person laugh

"Don't bother I know without your magic your strength is only that of a average human and you will need strengh of that of Cyborg to break out of those" The voice said laughing still a bit

"Who are you? What do you what with me? Raven asked her eyes now starting to adjust to the light as she open them wider

"Why don't we start with interductions first then get to the why I have you here part" The voice said as the person stepped in the light

Raven's eyes where fully adjusted and open them wide to see who it was which only made her eyes go wider as before her stood....?

1211.content:
"Friend Raven, may I please join you in the meditating?" Starfire asked while knocking on Raven's door. She waited for a reply, but heard nothing. She knocked again, still nothing. She tried again, but making sure to knock harder. Starfire was getting impatient and knocked even harder...a little too hard. She had created a large hole in the middle of Raven's door.

"Please! Please forgive me! I did no mean to damage your door." Starfire looked through the large hole and didn't see Raven.

Starfire wanted to be sure, so she stepped inside the room to see if Raven was there so that she could appologize and help fix the door.

When she looked around the room, she was frighten by the gothic items in Raven's room, yet somehow facinated by them. She was about to leave when she noticed a book in Raven's room. It was a book with a symbol the looked almost tamarainina in origin. Curious she picked up the book nd skimmed through it. Despite having a symbol that looked like it was from her homeworld, everything else was in a language she didn't recognise.

Yet she saw some writing that caught her eye. It was written in bright green ink, and written in large letters that made it stand out from the other spell. Unfortunately, Starfire was a little too interested in the spell. She mumbled the spell as she looked at the strange word. Her volume was almost a whisper, and yet it was loud enough gor the spell to be activated. Soon the room glowed in an errie green light.

Then, dar green smoke entered the room. The smoke covered every inch of the room, so there was no where for Starfire to escape soon she inhaled the green smoke. And shortly after...

1513.content:
Now, there are two ways I see that this could happen(bare in mind, that I'm going off of what I can remember from the series, and the couple of comics I read of Teen Titans Go!).

~ Kid Flash is always eating, since he apparently has a hyperactive metabolism, and as several parts of pop-culture has shown, being around someone like that, and you will start to eat more than you normally would.

~ From what I remembered from the comics, Kid Flash hit on anything remotely female with two legs, this pisses Jinx off, ergo, she takes her anger out on sweets and junkfood.

Or you can come up with your own story line ideas.

1543111.title: Which choices to make from here?

15431111.content:
"AU Canon" "before" "Sisters" or "after"?

What exactly will it be?
15431111.title: Choice I Here And So What More Choices Here?

154311111.content:
What choices to make here, exactly?

Choice I: Some point after the events of "Teen Titans" Episode "Go" which takes place chronologically at the very beginning, right at at least before "Sisters", after Robin, Starfire, Cyborg, Beastboy and Raven form the titular team, and all the while upon her "arrival" to "Earth", Blackfire finds at least some way - or through the use of using her "charm and persuasion" in a "Jump City "Local Casino"" - to get enough "money" - of course without "cheating" - for Blackfire to "be able to be "rich"" and to "be able to "own a residence of her own"" in "Jump City", after which she then finds "Earth "clothing"" to "conceal herself and what and who she is" from "the citizens" of "Jump City", after which, in turn, Blackfire manages to get a "part-time" job as a "test-taster", resulting in her "weight gain". Some time after this, in turn, Blackfire crosses paths with Starfire for the first time since the events involving these "Gordanians" laid siege to the place called "The Planet "Tamaran"" during which Blackfire had without anyone else knowing of it secretly made a deal with that later lead to the capture of her sister Starfire, immediately "after" Blackfire ends up causing herself to "gain weight", leading Starfire to be shocked by her realizing upon their crossing paths again, out of not recognizing Blackfire at first due to Blackfire's "weight gain", for the first time since the aforementioned event, all the while with even Starfire not knowing about her sister's secret "betrayal" against her, and yet with Blackfire, in part out of regret despite not knowing anyone else from "Tamaran" knowing about it all but having ended up "leaving" "Tamaran" in "self-imposed exile". Blackfire never confesses this out of this partial regret mixed in with shame.

Choice II: Similar to Choice I, with the difference here being that Blackfire, despite managing to "see" her sister Starfire, along with Robin, Cyborg, Beastboy and Raven - "by the time of this moment taking place" being also at this point when Blackfire's "weight gain" has already "happened" - all the while, while away from them enough for them to not see her, chooses to "not dare" show herself to Starfire or "anyone with Starfire" out of her shame and regret spoken of back in Choice I, thus causing them to "never cross paths again" - not even for the first time since the aforementioned "secret" "betrayal" Blackfire "committed" against her sister Starfire, AT LEAST until MUCH LATER.
154311111.title: At what point "AU Canon" "Before" "Sisters"?

1543111111.content:
One more description for this choice: -

Whichever the choice made here is, the way the "storyline" will go in the direction of, from here, either way, will be like this: -

In this "storyline", Blackfire ends up drowning her emotional states caused by her regret and shame mentioned before this choice while in her "new home" in "Jump City of "Planet Earth"" by drowning her emotional states in the use of "over-eating", causing Blackfire to "gain weight" before her "part-time" "taste-tester" "job"", which simply causes her to "gain weight" even more. Blackfire has also never stolen some "green gem like object" like she did back in the "Sisters "Episode"", thus causing her to not be targeted as "a fugitive from Tamaran" and for Starfire to thus never be "mistaken" for her sister. When Blackfire and Starfire cross paths again for the first time since the betrayal mentioned previously, not only is it that Blackfire has already ended up with her "weight gain", but when they cross paths again, Starfire does not recognize her at first when they cross paths again due to Blackfire's "weight gain" - leading Starfire to not only be shocked but also "worried" "for her sister" upon realizing that Blackfire has "gained weight" - with Blackfire's "weight gain" caused by her "pre-part-time-taste-tester-job-overeating" and her "doing all she does as a part-time-taste-tester" type of "over-eating" to have been enough that both even in "time WAAAAY before" Blackfire and Starfire's "reunion "on" "Earth"" and "daily events taking place up to it", "the constant over-eating" had been leading it to already happening to have been that, in turn: -

Blackfire, Starfire's older sister, had gotten FAT.

As for the choices to make from here with the above description still being way the storyline will go in the direction of, from here, either way: -

Here are these very choices: -

Choice I: -

Eventually at some point after their paths have crossed again for the first time since the betrayal described before this "choice", Blackfire confesses to her sister Starfire the part she played that led the latter to be taken by these "Gordanians" and explains the circumstances, etc., only for Starfire to "understand" her and even "forgive" her.

Choice II: -

Blackfire never confesses her "secret" "betrayal" at all.
1543111111.title: One more description for this choice....

choices: Blackfire's betrayal is never revealed for a long time
15431111112.content:
An additional description for this choice: -

Since Blackfire never confesses at all, here are some options as to how it is revealed, if it ever is: -

Revealing of it all Option I: -
Some antagonizer or an enemy of "the "Teen Titans"", the organization Starfire, Backfire's sister is a part of that includes herself, Robin, Cyborg, Beastboy and Raven, somehow figures out what and who Blackfire is, what Blackfire did, etc., and tries to use some "reverse psychology" to personally discredit Blackfire, only for it to not work, and for Starfire to still forgive Blackfire when the latter explains herself, etc., and Starfire understands it, leading the two to make amends.

Revealing of it all Option II: -

Starfire finds out about it all in some random way that doesn't involve dealing with "some villains", prompting her to confront her sister Blackfire, who then explains herself. Starfire understands, and they make amends.

Otherwise, this option would be this: -

Blackfire's mentioned betrayal is never revealed at all, for a long time, that is.
15431111112.title: Choice II

1543111112.content:
In that case, for the chosen option here, is a description with some options to go with it: -

Since Blackfire is too ashamed to show herself to her sister Starfire and anyone with her, she hides herself from her sister and her aforementioned friends, and as such, Blackfire and her sister don't cross paths again until much later. Whatever happens as a result of this: -

155121.content:
Laura Demillie also known as the supervillianess Madame Rouge slowly awoke from her slumber. She had no idea where she was or how she had got there, as the last thing she could recall was seeing her incompetent comrades being defeated by a bunch of superpowered children before she had ended up getting tricked and captured by raw superior numbers before she'd had a chance to escape.

The black haired woman look around her new surroundings and saw that she was currently surrounded by four blank white walls, and seated in some kind of high tech chair with a weird mask attached to her mouth leading up to the ceiling on a hose. Her limbs were also strapped won in place against the table and her captors had even gone the extra mile to tie her arms and legs into large protracted knots... the fools.

With but a few seconds of proper concentration Madame Rouge was able to untiwist her limbs, and then thin them down enough to slip free from her restraints.

At least most of her restraints, no matter how she tugged and pulled she couldn't get the strange piece of equipment attached to her mouth loose. Deciding that it must have been coated with some kind of adhesive Laura turned her attention elsewhere. Her rubbery fists grew to many times their normal size and she began to pound away at the walls of her cell. There was no obvious way out at the moment, but Madame Rouge was could already see chips of whatever the walls of her cells were made of starting to fly away.

It didn't mater to her if she had to keep pounding away for weeks or even months sooner or later she would be free, they hadn't invented a prison yet that could hold Madame Rouge!

Suddenly a strange whirring noise filled her ears, and she saw bulges appearing in the hose that was connected to the mouth fixed to her mouth, and for a few moments was spellbound into watching the progress of those bulges. As the first one finally reached its destination Laura's lips found themselves awash with the taste of...
